item.title: ZSFG expert page transformation
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
There’s another update to the ongoing project to emphasize human-centered service provided by the library. The ZSFG Library page is no longer just a location page — it now highlights the full breadth of services users can expect. ZSFG Library has always been more challenging to represent and promote, because it serves ...

Read moreZSFG expert page transformation

item.title: Video orientation
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
The library home page now has an embedded video orientation to the library. This overview of our spaces, services, and collections is delivered in a friendly and engaging way by Ariel. It was originally part of a longer UCSF orientation video, but the library section has been extracted, and Sean ...

Read moreVideo orientation

item.title: Highlighting services during closure
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
By default, the library already offers many services where the location of the user is not an obstacle. For example, we provide online access to many articles and ebooks. We also provide support and consultations via email, phone, or Zoom. In light of the lengthy buildings closure during the COVID-19 ...

Read moreHighlighting services during closure

item.title: User Research Results Part 2: Library News
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
News posts and newsletter content enable the library to share current happenings and to highlight and promote services. Our goal is to make these types of information discoverable in multiple places and whenever possible, put them into the path of the people who will find them most useful. Some users ...

Read moreUser Research Results Part 2: Library News

item.title: Unlock! Structure and Accessibility
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
Accessibility can be a confusing topic, but we can start by looking to UCSF standards and expectations to get a sense of where to focus our efforts. If we’re talking about web content, using platforms (e.g. Moodle, WordPress, Zendesk, LibApps, etc.) that are build with accessibility in mind whenever possible really ...

Read moreUnlock! Structure and Accessibility

item.title: Student IT Support expert page
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
There’s another update to the ongoing project to emphasize human-centered service in the Library. The Tech Commons has always provided IT support to students, but it was listed as just one of several things offered in that space. After talking with the Help Desk staff about the kinds of questions ...

item.title: Makers Lab expert page transformation
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
The User Experience Team continues to make progress on transforming and updating the Library’s expert pages to highlight key areas where we offer human-centered services. Anyone with a UCSF ID can access articles, but it’s the guidance and expertise offered by Library staff that really add value. Back in the ...

Read moreMakers Lab expert page transformation

item.title: How to post Library News
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
Library news is one of the most dynamic and widely viewed parts of our website. It can be viewed all together, but posts are also embedded in the path of the target audience in places like Programming for Data Science and Makers Lab. News posts are also shared via email ...

item.title: Updating Web Content
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
As most of you realize, the library’s web presence is not just a single site, though we try to make things as seamless as possible for users. The UX Team has recently been taking stock and strategizing about how to make things more consistent, as well as easier for content ...

item.title: Data Science refocused
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
A few months ago, the User Experience Team began to strategize about ways to highlight all the types of expertise and service that the Library offers. We looked at usage patterns on existing web pages and had in-depth discussions with various library staff experts to surface answers to questions like ...
